pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUponPart 1: 1980 RAF Bentwaters Lights and CraftWere “Extraterrestrial In Origin”© 2009 by Linda Moulton Howe“I wish to make it perfectly clear that the UFOs that I sawwere structured machines moving under intelligent control and operatingbeyond the realm of anything I have ever seen before or since. I believethe objects that I saw at close quarter were extraterrestrial in origin ... ” - Lt. Col. Charles I. Halt (Ret.), former Dep. Base Commander, RAFBentwaters, in June 25, 2009 press release from Gary Heseltine, PRUFOS Click for podcast.Lt. Col. Charles I. Halt described mysterious aerial light that emitted beamdown to the weapons storage facility (said to be nuclear) at RAF Bentwaters,England, in the early morning hours of December 28, 1980. Illustrationby Jan Roth at www.re ndle sham-incide nt.co.uk used with permission. July 17, 2009 Wakefield, West Yorkshire, England - A press release dated June 25,2009, was released on the internet and contained this startling quote by retired USAF Lt.Col. Charles I. Halt:“I wish to make it perfectly clear that the UFOs that I saw were structuredmachines moving under intelligent control and operating beyond the realm ofanything I have ever seen before or since. I believe the objects that I saw atclose quarter were extraterrestrial in origin and that the security services ofboth the United States and England were and have been complicit in trying tosubvert the significance of what occurred at Rendlesham by use ofwell-practiced methods of disinformation.”That press release came from Gary Heseltine, a police officer and long-time UFOresearcher. Col. Halt's unexpected assertion is about the extraterrestrial origin of what heand his military team encountered in the British Rendlesham Forest near RAF Bentwatersand RAF Woodbridge air bases in the early morning of December 28, 1980.

On left, Gary Heseltine meeting retired USAF Lt. Col. Charles I. Halt in Englandfor the first time in December 2007, during a documentary production for the American HistoryChannel about a series of UFO events at the joint U. S. and RAF Bentwaters AFB nearRendlesham Forest, England, between the early morning hours of December 26and December 28, 1980. Image provided by Gary Heseltine.Gary Heseltine, 49, was born and raised in Scunthorpe, Lincolnshire, U. K. until age 23when he joined the Royal Air Force in police security. He served for six years until 1989and then left to work for the British Transport Police. There are forty-three county policeforces in England, Scotland and Wales and there is one national police force that policesthe railway network in the United Kingdom. For the past fifteen years, Gary has served asa plain clothes detective constable in the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).Gary Heseltine in 1989 during his basic training for theBritish Transport Police for whom he still works today as a plain clothesdetective constable in the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).Photograph courtesy Gary Heseltine.He sought out police work because of an experience he had when he was fifteen years old

living in his home town of Scunthorpe, Lincolnshire, England.Interview:Gary Heseltine, Detective Constable, CID (Criminal Investigation Dept), BritishTransport Police, Wakefield, West Yorkshire County, England: “My interest beganwhen I was 15-years-old and I saw a UFO, for want of a better word. A light in the skythat seemed to trigger a number of power grid failures - all the lights went out, which isoften attributed to the presence of UFOs.That incident created my interest in the UFO subject, which has stayed with me. So, forthe last 34 years, I have been very interested in the subject of UFOs so much so that by2001, I wanted to become an active researcher. But the problem was that as a policedetective, if a rape occurs, your time is not your own. You can work for hours and hoursand hardly be at home. I had to come up with something I could research, but it wouldhave to be on my own because of the hours and nature of the police job that I work.And one day, I came up with the idea of police officers. I’d read about one or two policeofficers in several books and began to speculate that police officers have probably seenmany, many strange things, but there is never an outlet or mechanism to allow them tocome forward.So, in January 2002, I created what is called the PRUFOS database, which stands forPolice Reporting UFO Sightings. I started off with half a dozen sightings by a dozen policeofficers. After seven years of research, I’ve now got 300 reports dating back to 1901,involving over 700 British police officers. So, it’s grown a helluva lot!” Example of PRUFOS Police EncounterGary Heseltine says that one of the most startling reports came from Police ConstableAlan Godfrey in 1980, who watched a diamond-shaped aerial object suspended in the airabove a road in Todmorden, West Yorkshire. Policeman Godfrey tried to turn on his policeradio to call for help, but the radio was strangely dead. Then he got out of his police car,but was blinded by a bright, white light. PC Godfrey's next conscious memory was findinghimself back in his car mysteriously moved to a different location down the road. Thewhite light was gone. Haunted by the encounter, PC Godfrey sought hypnosis. Whatemerged was his description of being on a spacecraft with small, non-human entitiesexamining his body. See: PRUFOS, Police Reporting UFO Sightings.Gary Heseltine: “As a result of that database, I've become known within the UFOcommunity and from time to time, I’ll be asked to take part in various televisiondocumentaries. And on one occasion in December 2007, the American History Channelwas making a couple of documentaries in the U. K. - one about police officer sightings - sothat’s why I was involved. And in the process of talking to their producer, I asked whatelse they were producing in England. They said they were going to make a documentaryabout Rendlesham Forest (the 1980 RAF Bentwaters encounters with lights and craft). Iasked who else was involved and they said they were flying Col. Charles Halt from the U.S. to Engla nd. Gary Heseltine Worked RAF Securityof Nuclear WeaponsMy interest in the Bentwaters UFO incident stems from the fact that during my six years inthe Royal Air Force, I served on two nuclear bases – one in the U. K. and one in what wasthen West Germany, protecting nuclear weapons and the layouts of the bases of whichBentwaters and Woodbridge were leased from the RAF with a very similar design to thebases that I had worked on in security protecting nuclear weapons.I personally had always suspected that there must have been many more witnessesinvolved who have yet to be tracked down. So I said I had a theory because I worked onnuclear weapons bases – was there any way I could visit them on the Rendleshamproduction?They said yes and I spent three days on the documentary down at Rendlesham and duringthat process spent a lot of time with Col. Charles Halt, whom I had never met before.THAT WAS WHAT YEAR AND MONTH?

That was December 2007.SO YOU WERE THERE AT THE SAME LIGHT AND TIME OF THE ORIGINALEVENTS OF DECEMBER 26 TO 28?I think that was the idea of the American History Channel.COULD YOU JUMP TO THE MOST RECENT JUNE 2009 PRESS RELEASE FROMYOU CONCERNING A FILM YOU ARE NOW WORKING ON AND THAT YOUCOULD READ FOR ME NOW THE STATEMENT THAT YOU INCLUDE IN YOURRELEASE FROM COL. HALT?Yes, just before I do that, I want to make perfectly clear that at this moment in time a filmis not being made. What I have done, having met Col. Halt some nineteen months ago, is Iasked him during those three days of TV production had anybody ever tried to write a filmscript about Rendlesham Forest? He said, ‘No.’ I said, ‘Well, I sort of do like to write.Would you allow me to write it, research it, and collaborate with you on it?’ And he saidthere and then, ‘Yes, I’ll help you in any way I can.’So, basically what happened is that I went away for about four months and researched allthe known documentaries, books, articles that had been put out about the events atRendlesham. I created, using some of my police detective acumen, a very detailed timeline of the events from literally the first night through to the point at which he sends off theHalt memorandum to the M. O. D. (Ministry of Defence). And then I went back to Haltand began asking him question after question and that happened for perhaps the nextfifteen months until we got to a stage where the first draft script was complete and I put itto him and said, ‘Look. What do you think?’ He didn’t get that draft until December 2008(half a year ago) when he got the first draft version. He read that and said it was great, heloved it and would fully endorse what was written.And since Christmas 2008, we have been adapting it and tweaking things as you would dowith any film script. So, what we have is a film script, which is available and (would like)to meet with film producers and that was the idea of putting out the press release in June2009, to announce that there has been a collaboration between Col. Halt and myself andthat we now have a workable film script that I believe is crying out to be made into afeature film.You’ve asked me to read the quote, right? The press release that was put out the 25th ofJune and which was mutually agreed upon and which Col. Halt is very happy to go outwith. June 25, 2009 Press Releaseby Gary Heseltine and Col. Charles Halt (Ret.)Deputy Base Commander, RAF Bentwaters, U. K., December 1980Col. Halt said: “I wish to make it perfectly clear that the UFOs I saw were structuredmachines moving under intelligent control and operating beyond the realm of anything Ihave ever seen before or since. I believe the objects that I saw at close quarter wereextraterrestrial in origin and that the security services of both the United States andEngland were and have been complicit in trying to subvert the significance of whatoccurred at Rendlesham by use of well-practiced methods of disinformation.“I believe Gary's script will lift a veil of secrecy about what really happened atRendlesham, events that were and still are of tremendous defense significance to theUnited Kingdom and indeed the rest of the world.” Brief RAF Bentwaters and Woodbridge HistoryIn 1942, the British Royal Air Force constructed an air base between Butley and Tunstall(larger pink circle near top of map) in Suffolk County, England, on the northeastern edgeof Rendlesham Forest. It was called RAF Butley – about 4 miles northeast of RAFWoodbridge (larger pink circle on far left). More trees were planted to build up theRendlesham Forest in the 1940s to help shield military activities.

To the south was the RAF Bawdsey Chain Home Radar Station (bottom pink circle onmap) that during WWII monitored the launch of V2 rockets from Germany. Althoughthere was no defense against the V2 rocket, RAF Bawdsey was able to provide the BritishBomber Command with the location of the V2 launch sites, which could then be attacked.East of Butley at Orford Ness (far right pink circle), an experimental MADRE over-the-horizon radar station was constructed in 1961 to monitor Soviet launches.The United States Air Force 81st Fighter Interceptor Wing and the 67th AerospaceRescue and Recovery Squadron (ARRS) leased the original RAF Butleyafter WWII under the new name RAF Bentwaters.After the end of World War II, RAF Butley was renamed RAF Bentwaters by Britain’sMinistry of Defence and leased to the United States Air Force for its 81st FighterInterceptor Wing and the 67th Aerospace Rescue and Recovery Squadron (ARRS).

By 1958, RAF Bentwaters and RAF Woodbridge became a joint U. S. Air Force and RoyalAir Force complex with the big, thick Rendlesham Forest in between.Aerial image of the runway at RAF Woodbridge surrounded by the thick Rendlesham Forest.In 1992, after the Berlin Wall came down and the Soviet Cold War thawed, the UnitedStates cancelled its involvement with RAF Woodbridge and RAF Bentwaters. The historicRAF Bentwaters is now a privately owned business park, while RAF Woodbridge is usedby the U. K. Ministry of Defence for Army training exercises. What Happened In Rendlesham ForestDecember 26 - 28, 1980?What exactly did happen between midnight on December 26, to 5 AM on December 28,1980, that provoked U. S. Air Force Lt. Col. Charles Halt and Airman 1st Class JohnBurroughs to describe lights in the Rendlesham Forest as “alive” and “speaking” to themtelepathically on December 28, 1980? Those words were used by John Burroughs in a1988 hypnosis session to describe his and Col. Charles Halt’s impressions of the lights.There were even rumors that Burroughs jumped on a craft or was taken up in a beam oflight.

East Gate at RAF Woodbridge, England.As the clock was about to change from Christmas day 1980 to midnight, December 26,1980, 20-year-old Airman First Class (A1C) John Burroughs was on Security Police dutyat RAF Woodbridge’s back gate, commonly known as the “East Gate.” With AirmanBurroughs was Staff Sergeant (SSgt) Bud Steffens. RAF Woodbridge was four miles westof RAF Bentwaters (in Butley, Suffolk County).Some time after midnight, Sgt. Steffens and Airman John Burroughs saw strange, colorfullights hovering at tree-top level in the Rendlesham Forest east of the gate.East Gate at RAF Woodbridge open with road and Rendlesham Forest beyond.So, Burroughs and Steffens drove their patrol car out the East Gate on a road alongRendlesham Forest. The colorful red, orange and blue lights in the clear night sky seemedcloser than before. Suddenly a large, white light appeared moving along the edge of theforest as if pacing their car and seemed to move closer to them.Later on, Airman Burroughs submitted a hand-written statement about what he saw to theRAF Bentwaters Deputy Base Commander, Lt. Col. Charles Halt.Excerpt of John Burroughs's hand-written statement after the December 26 toDecember 28, 1980, UFO incidents in Rendlesham Forestbetween Bentwaters AFB and RAF Woodbridge.John Burroughs hand-written statement about lights he and others saw in the early morninghours of December 26, 1980: “The lights were red and blue, the red one above the blueone and they were flashing on and off. Because I never saw anything like that comingfrom the woods before, we (Burroughs and Steffens) decided to drive down and see whatit was. We went down East Gate road and took a right at the stop sign and drove downabout 10 to 20 yards to where there is a (dirt logging) road that goes into the forest. At

the road, I could see a white light shining onto the trees and I could still see the red andblue lights.Red arrow points to dirt logging trail that turns off main East Gate road.John Burroughs sketch of lights he saw on the first night of December 26, 1980.Date of his above sketch was January 2, 1981.John Burroughs notes on January 2, 1981 sketch of lights: “This would move back andforth, up and down, but the blue and white and orange would come out when it was sittingin one place. Blue lights would come out of the beam and the white light below. Bluelights would blink on and off inside the beam, plus the beam would be red and orange. Awhite light would come out below the beam in the trees. ( AIC John Burroughs 81SPSSPOL CFLT”)Signed, Airman 1st Class, John Burroughs, 81st Security Police Squadron, Security PoliceOperations, Charley Flight.John Burroughs told me he was overwhelmed with the feeling “something was not right!”He and Steffens drove back to the East Gate. They phoned a Sgt. McCabe to report whathad been happening and McCabe alerted the Central Security Control. That early morningof December 26, 1980, Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston was duty supervisor at RAFWoodbridge and drove to the East Gate in a truck with newly assigned Airman 1st ClassEdward Cabansag to see for himself what was happening.Sgt. Penniston asked Airman John Burroughs and Sergeant Bud Steffens if the lights couldbe from an airplane crash in the forest. Steffens replied: “It did not crash. It landed!”Jim Penniston would later say in interviews that after a call to the Shift Commander’soffice, he was told to proceed off base toward the mysterious lights with the two other

security policemen, John Burroughs and Ed Cabansag. The three American men were toldto leave their weapons behind to comply with the British military’s Status ForcesAgreement.Back in Sgt. Penniston’s truck, the men drove out of the East Gate and on to the loggingroad that ran through the Rendlesham Forest where Burroughs and Steffens had beenearlier. Penniston said the road was full of potholes and was so frozen it was hard to drivethe truck. So, the men decided to park.Orange path drawn by Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston on aerial of East Gate on left,the road out in which the second 90 degree turn is on the dirt loggingtrail out to “Vehicle Stop” and “Landing Site.”After the three men stopped the truck, Ed Cabansag walked with Sgt. Penniston andAirman Burroughs into the woods until their first strange light encounter. John Burroughswrote afterward that there was a light that rose in the air above the Rendlesham trees. “Allthree of us hit the ground and whatever it was started moving back towards the openfield.” After that, the men decided that Cabansac should stay there to relaycommunications, while Penniston and Burroughs continued walking deeper into thewoods.Burroughs and Penniston also described feeling hair on their arms and back of their necksstand up like in the electrostatic atmosphere of a thunderstorm. But it was a clear, coldnight without storms.Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston was Duty Supervisor at RAF Woodbridge onDecember 26, 1980. This image is allegedly one of the original notebook pages written bySgt. Penniston during the three nights of Rendlesham Forest UFO activity. The top dateappears to read: “27 Dec. 80” with a note about an aircraft crash, “A/C crash.”According to notes in Sgt. Penniston’s notebook shown here and his official written report,he and Airman Burroughs got to the center of Rendlesham Forest.Excerpt of Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston's typed statementabout light encounters in early hours of December 26, 1980.Penniston Text: “When we got within a 50 meter distance (150 feet), the object wasproducing red and blue light. The blue light was steady and projecting under the object.

It was lighting up the area directly under extending a meter or two out. At this point ofpositive identification, I relayed to CSC, SSgt Coffey. Postitive siting (sic) of object ...color of lights and that it was defidently (sic) mechaniclal (sic) in nature.” Sgt. Penniston contacted Staff Sergeant Coffey at Central Security Control and told himthat the object “was definitely mechanical in nature.”Penniston much later in time on December 16, 2002, told a U. K. interviewer: ‘I have mynotes from that night in my notebook. And it says what I wrote:Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston's sketch of triangle-shaped, dark glassy surfacedcraft he photographed and touched in early hours of December 26, 1980.Notes about sketched craft in Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston's notebook: “Triangularin shape. The top portion is producing mainly white light which encompasses most of theupper section of the craft. A small amount of white light is appearing from what appears tobe the bottom of the craft. At the left side is a bluish light. And on the other side is red.The lights seem to be molded as part of the exterior of the structure that seemed to belanded on the forest floor.”Penniston also said that the air was filled with electricity – like static. “You could feel it onyour skin as you approached the object. There was also a sense of slowness, like time itselfwas an effort. I got to within ten feet of the craft in the clearing where it sat.”Penniston estimated the craft to be three meters long at the base and two meters high, or10 feet long by 7 feet high. No landing gear was apparent, but the object seemed like itwas on fixed legs. Penniston said he walked right up to the craft and noticed the fabric ofthe shell was like a smooth, opaque, black glass. He said, “No animals were even makingnoise anymore. The nearer we got to that thing, the more uneasy I felt – it was as if I weremoving in slow motion.”John Burroughs agreed, “It was a weird feeling, like everything seemed slower than youwere actually doing.” Strangely, John Burroughs to this day does not remember seeing JimPenniston near such a craft. But Burroughs also knows his mind is blocked when he thinksabout the lights.John Burroughs also does not remember Sgt. Penniston having a camera, but Pennistonsays he took 36 photographs on 35mm film and sketched symbols that were engraved intothe craft’s shiny, black surface.Staff Sergeant James W. Penniston's sketch of 3-inch high symbols etched into the

dark, glassy craft's surface that he touched in early hours of December 26, 1980.Penniston has described the engraved symbols for TV programs this way: “On the smoothexterior shell, there was writing of some kind, but I couldn’t quite distinguish it. So, Imoved up to see 3-inch lettering – or rather symbols – that stretched for the length of twofeet, maybe a little more.”Then Sgt. Penniston reached out his hand. “I touched the symbols and I could feel theshapes as if they were inscribed or engraved, like a diamond cut on glass.”When Sgt. Penniston’s fingers touched the engraved symbols, he said the craft’s upperwhite light instantly grew much brighter, almost blinding. Both Penniston and JohnBurroughs fell to the ground in a defensive move.Penniston said, “ The craft moved up off the ground about three feet, still with absolutelyno sound. It started to move slowly. It took a couple of minutes for it to maneuver itselfback to a distance of about 100 to 150 feet. Then it rose up just over the trees, about 200feet high. There was a momentary pause and then literally with the blink of an eye, it wasgone. All with no sound! That still boggles my mind.”After the craft disappeared, both men felt normal again. The slow motion feeling wentaway. Then John Burroughs saw more colored lights in the forest. Burroughs andPenniston tried to go after those lights, too, but changed their minds, turned around andwent back to the truck.On their way back, Burroughs found three indentations in the forest soil where the craftmust have been resting on three tripod legs to form a triangle pattern of indentations in thesoil with each leg ten feet apart. Further, each indentation was the shape of a triangle.Sketch of the tripod indentations in Rendlesham Forest “landing site”by Vince Thurkettle in February 1981 site investigation.

Photograph of triangle-shaped indention in the soil of Rendlesham Forest “landing site.”After returning with Airman Cabansag to the air base, Burroughs and Penniston were told“it is best to keep quiet about what you have seen.” But the two men decided to go back tothe forest to look for more physical evidence beyond the tripod indentations. They foundscorch marks on the trees and branches broken off.Jim Penniston said he made plaster casts, such as the one photographed above,of the triangle-shaped indentations in the ground discoveredin the early morning hours of December 26, 1980.Two nights later on December 28, 1980, after midnight, John Burroughs felt drawn back tothe Rendlesham Forest and encountered lights again. This time RAF Bentwaters DeputyBase Commander Lt. Col. Charles Halt was in the forest with a tape recorder, light-allsand other equipment to document the persistent and unusual light phenomena.Col. Halt said on the tape recording December 28, 1980: “Now we’re observing whatappears to be a beam coming down to the ground. This is unreal! ...”

Lt. Col. Charles I. Halt described mysterious aerial light that emitted white, narrow, beamdown in front of him and over the weapons storage facility (above), said to contain nuclearwarheads, at RAF Bentwaters, England, in the early morning hours of December 28, 1980.Illustration by Jan Roth at www.re ndle sham-incide nt.co.uk used with permission. Continued in Part 2More Information:Former U. S. Air Force 1st Class Airman John Burroughs is now organizing a2010 reunion in England for all the military personnel in RAF Bentwaters andRAF Woodbridge who were involved in the mysterious light phenomena ofDecember 26 - 28, 1980.
